basics.name: Kaveh Ghalambor
basics.label: Software Engineer
basics.summary: A passionate software engineer born and rasied in the Bay Area.

work.name: Extreme Networks
work.summary: Contributing to the Extreme's network management solution. I assist in ensuring system level and API performace in the application and platform levels of the product

Previous Work.summary: Lead organizer for the New York City branch of the People's Climate March, the largest climate march in history.
highlights: Awarded 'Climate Hero' award by Greenpeace for my efforts organizing the march.
Men of the year 2014 by Time magazine

education.institution: California Polytechnic University, San Luis Obispo

awardsSkip.title: Nobel Prize in Physics
awardsSkip.summary: The Nobel Prizes are five separate prizes that, according to Alfred Nobel's will of 1895, are awarded to 'those who, during the preceding year, have conferred the greatest benefit to humankind.'

publicationsSkip.name: Zur Elektrody/namik bewegter Körper
publicationsSkip.summary: It concerned an interpretation of the Michelson–Morley experiment and the properties of light and time. Special relativity incorporates the principle that the speed of light is the same for all inertial observers regardless of the state of motion of the source.

publicationsSkip.name: Über einen die Erzeugung und Verwandlung des Lichtes betreffenden heuristischen Gesichtspunkt
publicationsSkip.summary: In the second paper, he applied the quantum theory to light to explain the photoelectric effect. In particular, he used the idea of light quanta (photons) to explain experimental results, but stressed the importance of the experimental results. The importance of his work on the photoelectric effect earned him the Nobel Prize in Physics in 1921.

publicationsSkip.name: Die Grundlage der allgemeinen Relativitätstheorie
publicationsSkip.summary: The publication of the theory of general relativity made him internationally famous. He was professor of physics at the universities of Zurich (1909–1911) and Prague (1911–1912), before he returned to ETH Zurich (1912–1914).

projects.name: Inferring Ethnicity Through Name and Face
projects.summary: Applied web-scraping skills for gathering large datasets and testing them against multiple machine learning algorithms (mainly random forest). Utilized a python library that can accurately predict the ethnicity of a person with only their name and photo in order to explore patterns of collaboration between California professors using only their name and face according to Google Scholar. This project can be used by academic institutions to make improvements to their diversity and inclusion.
